oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Wilbur Foster Creighton, Jr., 1980 December 13
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Excerpts from an oral history interview with Nashville engineer Wilbur Foster Creighton, Jr., conducted on 13 December 1980 by Susan Cox as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. In these excerpts, Creighton discusses the East Nashville Fire of 1916; his grandfather R.M. Dudley, his home at Pioneer Spring, and how he would help his grandfather stock Shelby and Centennial Lakes; his grandfather Creighton's ownership of Rockwood Stone Quarry in Alabama and how it was taken over by the government during World War I; Foster & Creighton Company, the company co-founded by his grandfather Robert T. Creighton; and some of Foster & Creighton's early jobs, including the Parthenon, Union Station, and the Sparkman and Shelby Street Bridges. The complete interview, as well as an index, is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Creighton, Wilbur F., 1906-2004--Interviews; Dudley, R.M.; Creighton, Robert Thomas, 1855-1927
